section.heading: Nonparentage as defense.
section.text: A party whose parentage of a child has been previously determined by, or pursuant to, law may not plead nonparentage as a defense to a proceeding under this chapter.

annoGroup.heading: Effective Dates
annoGroup.annotation: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provided: “This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007.”

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Former § 46-303.15 has been recodified as § 46-303.16 by D.C. Law 16-137, § 2(c)(16).
Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 315 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
